intro: Tibouchina herbacea var. hirsutissima, commonly known as the hairy tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage. The plant produces clusters of showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom throughout the warmer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscape designs.
